_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

Fourteen religious donations to individu: A gift to the Realized One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha
A gift to a Buddha awakened for themselves
A gift to a perfected one
A gift to someone practicing to realize the fruit of perfection
A gift to someone practicing to realize the fruit of non-return
A gift to someone practicing to realize the fruit of once-return
A gift to someone practicing to realize the fruit of stream-entry
A gift to an outsider who is free of sensual desire
A gift to an ordinary person who has good ethical conduct
A gift to an ordinary person who has bad ethical conduct
Gifts to the following persons and their: An unethical ordinary person - a thousand
An ethical ordinary person - a hundred thousand
An outsider free of sensual desire - 10,000,000,000
Someone practicing to realize the fruit of stream-entry - incalculable, immeasurable returns
Seven religious donations bestowed on a: A gift to the communities of both monks and nuns headed by the Buddha
A gift to the communities of both monks and nuns after the Buddha has finally become extinguished
A gift to the Saṅgha of monks
A gift to the Saṅgha of nuns
A gift, thinking: ‘Appoint this many monks and nuns for me from the Saṅgha.’
A gift, thinking: ‘Appoint this many monks for me from the Saṅgha.’
A gift, thinking: ‘Appoint this many nuns for me from the Saṅgha.’
Four ways of purifying a religious donat: A religious donation that’s purified by the giver, not the recipient
A religious donation that’s purified by the recipient, not the giver
A religious donation that’s purified by neither the giver nor the recipient
A religious donation that’s purified by both the giver and the recipient
